properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Wind chill values near minus 55 will moderate later this morning but may redevelop tonight. ### Watch for cold related symptoms: shortness of breath, chest pain, muscle pain and weakness, numbness and colour change in fingers and toes. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:

Extreme cold will return again Tuesday evening over this area. ### Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowstorm on the way beginning Monday night. A low pressure system will emerge from Texas and track towards the Great Lakes on Monday. This low will bring an area of snow with it, reaching areas near Lake Superior Monday evening, then spreading east to the Quebec border by Tuesday morning, Total snowfall amounts of 10 to 20 cm are expected, with locally higher amounts possible. The snow will move out of the area by Tuesday evening as the low pressure area crosses Central or Eastern Ontario into Quebec. Poor winter driving conditions are expected. Motorists should be prepared to adjust their travel plans accordingly. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-02-17T20:12:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-02-17T04:13:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2269875924.2020

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow with total accumulations of 15 centimetres is expected. Snow will begin Tuesday morning over western areas, then spread toward central regions toward midday. The snow will end late in the evening. ### Rapidly accumulating snow will make travel difficult. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 20 cm is expected. Snowstorm beginning near midnight. A low pressure system emerging from Texas is tracking towards the Great Lakes today. This low will bring an area of snow with it, arriving near or shortly after midnight. Total snowfall amounts of 15 to 20 cm are expected by the time the snow moves out of the area by Tuesday evening. Driving conditions will quickly deteriorate after the snow arrives tonight. Motorists should be prepared to adjust their travel plans accordingly. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-02-18T09:41:45-00:00

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snowfall amounts possible on Tuesday. A low pressure system from Colorado will bring snow to several regions of Quebec on Tuesday. Snow will begin in the morning over Western Quebec and will spread toward the central and eastern regions during the day. Snowfall amounts of 10 to 15 cm are expected. Consider modifying any non essential travel plans. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-02-17T18:48:09-00:00

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowstorm beginning this evening. A low pressure system emerging from Texas is tracking towards the Great Lakes today. This low will bring an area of snow with it, arriving early this evening in the Sault Ste. Marie area then quickly spreading east to remaining regions north of Lake Huron and Georgian Bay by midnight. Total snowfall amounts of 15 to 20 cm are expected by the time the snow moves out of the area Tuesday morning. Driving conditions will quickly deteriorate after the snow arrives this evening. Motorists should be prepared to adjust their travel plans accordingly. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow on the way beginning this evening into tonight. A low pressure system will emerge from Texas and track towards the Great Lakes today. This low will bring an area of snow with it, arriving this evening near the shores of Lake Superior or tonight north of Lake Huron. Total snowfall amounts near 15 cm will be possible by the time the snow moves out of the area Tuesday morning. Snowfall warnings may be required. There is some uncertainty as to the exact track of the low, which will affect how much snow falls at a particular location. Poor winter driving conditions are expected beginning this evening. Motorists should be prepared to adjust their travel plans accordingly. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow this afternoon into tonight. A low pressure system emerging from Texas will track towards the Great Lakes today. This low is bringing an area of snow with it which will affect the region this afternoon and tonight. Total snowfall amounts of 10 to 15 cm are expected, with locally higher amounts possible by the time the snow moves out of the area overnight. Gusty southerly winds may cause occasional blowing snow in exposed areas into early this evening. Poor winter driving conditions are expected. Motorists should be prepared to adjust their travel plans accordingly. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow on the way beginning tonight into Tuesday morning. A low pressure system will emerge from Texas and track towards the Great Lakes today. This system will bring an area of snow with it, arriving tonight east of Georgian Bay. The snow will arrive Tuesday morning near and east of the National Capital region. Total snowfall amounts near 10 cm appear likely in most areas, with locally higher amounts up to 15 cm possible in the Ottawa Valley by the time the snow moves out of the area Tuesday evening. There is some uncertainty as to the exact track of the low, which will affect how much snow falls at a particular location. Poor winter driving conditions from accumulating snow and low visibility in areas of heavier snow are expected beginning tonight. Motorists should be prepared to adjust their travel plans accordingly. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-02-18T08:05:32-00:00

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are expected to persist until this evening. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of very cold wind chills is expected. Light to moderate northwesterly winds and temperatures near -40 are creating wind chill values near minus 55. Wind chill values will remain near minus 55 through Tuesday. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Risks are greater for young children, older adults, people with chronic illnesses, people working or exercising outdoors, and those without proper shelter. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
